entry.title: About Hugo
entry.content: hugo-smorg is a theme for Hugo, the blazingly fast super flexible static site engine. See the project page: https://github.com/solutionroute/hugo-smorg, and

entry.title: Hugo Bulma Powered Blog Theme: Hugo-Smorg
entry.content: Hugo-smorg (smorg = small org, or smorgasbord perhaps) is a responsive mobile-first, Bulma-powered, reasonably minimalistic theme for the Hugo https://gohugo.io/ static site generator.

entry.title: Syntax Highlighting
entry.content: Code examples in different languagues to demonstrate syntax highlighting with the current hugo-smorg theme. Inline code looks like this->var and expand($flurb, $times).

entry.title: Blorg Bread Baker
entry.content: The hand-crafted Blorg Bread Baker™ enhances any kitchen. Produced from 100% post-consumer recycled materials you’ll never once think… wait a minute, I’m baking my bread in other people’s refuse.

entry.title: XYZ 1000 Replicator
entry.content: With the XYZ 1000 Replicator you’ll never again be stuck with an empty kitchen and nothing for dinner! Features It’s like a chef from 1,783,482,482 (and counting) planets in your kitchen!

entry.title: Creating a New Theme
entry.content: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content.

entry.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
entry.content: Hugo uses the excellent go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic.

entry.title: Getting Started with Hugo
entry.content: Step 1. Install Hugo Goto hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your os and architecture. Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step.

entry.title: Migrate to Hugo from Jekyll
entry.content: Move static content to static Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output.
